website_summaries.verdict: A pack of 8 natural wool dryer balls that are dark in color. Choose these if you need dryer balls that won't leave white fibers on dark-colored clothing and linens.
pros: A good choice for drying dark laundry, as they are made from dark wool from New Zealand
Do a good job absorbing and transferring essential oils
Generous pack of 8 comes with a bag
cons: Some users notice a "sheep" smell at first, but it tends to fade
A bit smaller than some other options we considered

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty colored wool balls
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty colored wool balls, a tad smaller than some. Made a great discovery when I went to add a few drops of peppermint oil for scent to them. The dropper was missing and it "dumped" out of the jar! So what I did was put some of them into a jar in my entry way as air freshener ! I will continue to use wool balls as a non-toxic room freshener. :) and as static control.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: ... always interested in being more ecologically friendly and am pleased to have this alternative to dryer sheets
customer_reviews.text: I am always interested in being more ecologically friendly and am pleased to have this alternative to dryer sheets. These are the first drryer balls I have tried and the results are good, with some residual static cling.
customer_reviews.author: mark twain

customer_reviews.title: So cute and work really well!
customer_reviews.text: These things have cut AT LEAST 20 minutes off my dryer time and reduced static dramatically. I put them through the biggest test when I dried the blanket my sister crocheted for me. Went super fast and there was no static when normally I pull it out and it instantly clings to me. Plus they come in a cute little burlap sack. I got an old egg basket to put them in so they really look good in my laundry room!
customer_reviews.author: A.Jonak

customer_reviews.title: They don't really work in the dryer when you have ...
customer_reviews.text: They don't really work in the dryer when you have mixed loads. and for water conservation separtae loads are just not feasable. Everything (t-shirts, socks, all lingerie) still statically sticks to my flannel sheets and blankets and to each other. Sorry, I really wanted them to work since the aluminum foil balls didn't and the fabric softer sheets are just to chemically unsatisfactory, not to mention the overally strong scents! Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: ... brand and another brand - this one is my favorite. Why
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this brand and another brand - this one is my favorite. Why? Well they are slightly smaller (8 vs.6) and having more balls vs. the larger ones helps the clothes tumble better. I also really like the color better - it works for both light & dark. This was my first experience trying out wool dryer balls, I am hooked - my dryer time has been significantly reduced, no static AND bonus ...I can use a natural scent (I can't stand most dryer sheet scents). Will see how static does in the winter, but so far I am extremely pleased and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GReview12

customer_reviews.title: I really like these wool dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: I really like these wool dryer balls! They are reusable which saves me from having to buy one-time dryer sheets and they don't have a fragrance. Some of the products in the stores can have too much fragrance of which my husband doesn't like and competes with my perfume. They are soft and reduce static in our clothes. I bought a package of these dark-colored wool dryer balls (for our darker clothes, towels, and bedding) and a package of the light-colored wool dryer balls (for our whites and light-colored clothes, towels, and bedding). I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: ... over conventional dryer sheets but you have to use pretty much all of them in a regular size load ...
customer_reviews.text: I definitely prefer these over conventional dryer sheets but you have to use pretty much all of them in a regular size load of laundry to keep the static at bay. I infuse them with lavender essential oil.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Bouncing Balls
customer_reviews.text: Not convinced they work, but they're kinda cool to watch. Have tried 6, 4, 3 with and without essential oil and also with an aluminum ball...scent doesn't throw onto clothes and balls don't reduce static cling, (can they make it worse?). I'm kinda flummoxed. Besides watching them go "thud" in the dryer, I don't get the point. Oh right, they dry clothes faster. Maybe. But then again, have not seen a big difference. I'm giving 3 stars as I believe in eco friendly options, but not ones that don't work. Happy to take suggestions also, before I return to dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.author: minax

customer_reviews.title: I used four of the dryer balls and am so pleased with the result
customer_reviews.text: I just used these for the first time yesterday. I am making my own laundry soap and wanted to stop using the overly scented, expensive and often allergy resulting softeners that are out there. I used four of the dryer balls and am so pleased with the result. I DID have a very slight crackle of static as I removed my laundry, but oh so minor. I have used the knobby plastic dryer balls before and they are SO loud and annoying and I don't think they did half the job that the wool ones did. I feel good about using these and am quite happy with them. They are a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: ram bro

customer_reviews.title: I'm forever ditching fabric softener...
customer_reviews.text: Not only are these items of beauty (who doesn't love a natural wool ball?), but they work really well to fluff up my laundry without needing fabric softener. I even love the gentle "lub lub" sounds they make as they tumble in the dryer. My only dislike is that they are a bit smaller than I expected, more like a billiard ball than a tennis ball, so when you pull your clothes out of the dryer, they often hide with the clothes and then end up on the floor. It's a mad scramble to catch them before they roll under my folding table. But hey, I need the exercise, so no worries.
customer_reviews.author: Chezlise

customer_reviews.title: I do like adding essential oil scents so my clothes smell nice
customer_reviews.text: I do like adding essential oil scents so my clothes smell nice, but that is all the benefit I am seeing so far. These don't seem to keep down static or lint.I don't really know what other reviewers have tried in the past. As an alternative to chemical-laden drier sheets, they're fine, but not good; all my black cotton comes out with fuzz everywhere from the balls. I would prefer to use nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Gray color the best for light and dark clothes drying.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with light or dark clothes. Got these gray ones vs. getting a set of white ones AND a set of black ones. The fuzz does not transfer at all. They do make a lot of noise in the dryer but I believe they help clothes dry more evenly. Only complaint is that when you take items out of the dryer the balls fall everywhere or get stuck in clothes/sheets, etc. I find them all over the house. I would recommend tho.
customer_reviews.author: Whirlwindmom

customer_reviews.title: Less Dust, Static Free and Clean Drying
customer_reviews.text: We tried these for the first time on a day when it was about 19 deg. F outside, a good day to test the static reduction. The polyester running shirts came out nicely, not clingy at all, and not dusty which is a first. I live in an apt bldg and we share driers with the other tenants. There's white dust all over the laundry room which I read was caused by dryer sheets. As a person who has bad allergies, I'm constantly looking for ways to reduce dust! We'll continue to use these and see how they wear. I'd be game to start an apt-wide movement towards wool balls if they hold up well!
customer_reviews.author: New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: So far I like my share of the new ones
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought 3 large dryer balls in Sitka Alaska and gave one to me and one to our sister-in-law. She did not realize it should be 3 for each of us. I bought the 8-pack, they are quite a bit smaller than the original, so I will share these smaller ones with both girls. So far I like my share of the new ones, they are much tighter than the larger one we have and really do a good job on towels which tend to bunch up sometimes in the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: CLouise

customer_reviews.title: Increased dry time for our clothes :(
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to love these. They don't down on drying time at all. In fact, I've had to run a few loads through 2 dry cycles. :( That is a huge disappointment, because these are billed as "green" alternatives to dryer sheets...but they're not very "green" if you have to use more energy when using them. I'm not sure if we'll keep using these long-term. Really love the absence of chemicals not using dryer sheets, that is the only upside.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B

customer_reviews.title: I really like them. They take care of the static and ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how these would work but I was willing to give them a try. The fact that they can be reused and don't have harmful chemicals or strong perfume odors was a definite plus. Now that I have been using them, I really like them. They take care of the static and are much easier to locate in the dryer than the small dryer sheets. From now on, I will be using wool dryer balls and will not go back to dryer sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Augusta

customer_reviews.title: Wool Dryer Balls Really Work!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I was skeptical about what to expect from using these wool ball in the dryer. So far I have used them twice. Once for a load of jeans and another time for a comforter. They definitely helped with the drying time so less energy was used. The comforter fluffed up nicely. So far I am very happy with my purchase. Love the little storage bag too! No more fabric softener for me!
customer_reviews.author: JudiPen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: These are awful. I used others for almost a year, but they aren’t available anymore. These dryer balls get worse with every drying instead of better. Never had so much static! And I can’t return them for some reason which Amazon won’t tell me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I've used the wool balls for about a week now and love'em. I put 6 balls into an average dryer load and they work great. I've used them with whites, colors, towels, and even my delicate wash items and have had no problems. I haven't noticed that my drying time is shorter, but I haven't used a dryer sheet for the past week.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: but there is no appreciable difference in the fragrance and I decided that I'm not willing to waste 10 to 20 drops of oil per dr
customer_reviews.text: These balls may not create static in the dryer, but they don't do a thing to get rid of it. I added essential oils to a couple of the balls before I threw them in the dryer for a few loads, but there is no appreciable difference in the fragrance and I decided that I'm not willing to waste 10 to 20 drops of oil per dryer load; not cost-effective. Also, my towels came out so hard and rough feeling. It's not worth my time and effort to send these back so that was an eight dollar lesson learned. 😕
customer_reviews.author: Saint Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great laundry helper
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I always shake out my clothes before drying to reduce wrinkles and speed up drying time. Adding these to the dryer help with those two plus static is reduced Win. Win. Win. I have put a few drops lavender oil deep into the center of one and it is great for towels etc. mark it with a thread so you can remove it or trade it for another one for a different fragrance. LYellow for lemon, purple for lavender... I really like these. Great gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Mamasgottools

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: They worked okay for a while, but I feel like they left as much hair as they took away and the static was hit or miss. I tried everything. Adjusted the heat and dry times, and just couldn’t make them work for the majority of my laundry. I do use them with large heavy blankets or towels, but everything else I have to use the fragrance free fabric softener.
customer_reviews.author: D JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but doesn't eliminate static.
customer_reviews.text: What I really wanted these for is to reduce static, to be able to stop using liquid fabric softener. They don't eliminate static. However, they do seem to reduce drying time and definitely help to fluff up towels. The dark color is not a problem on whites, so they are good for all clothes. They leave no lint and seem to attract loose threads.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne Davis

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to our chemical free home!
customer_reviews.text: Clothes come out of the dryer soft and relatively static free. The build quality of the balls is great! I think they'll last for years and years to come. I like the little bag they came in with the usage instructions too. That was a nice touch. The bag says to not use them with lighter colored clothes, but we did (oops!) and haven't had any problems with it. So that's good! *thumbs up*
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: I have been very impressed and happy. They've cut my drying time close to in ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the hype about these online, I finally decided to try some and see how well they work. And, I have to say, I have been very impressed and happy. They've cut my drying time close to in half! I no longer need to use dryer sheets, so these things will pay for themselves within a few months. I'd highly recommend them to anyone who is looking to save money on their bills and who wants to get away from all the harsh chemicals in most of the products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: These do seem to shorten drying time, but I ...
customer_reviews.text: These do seem to shorten drying time, but I notice that polyester fabrics are still static-y when I remove them from the dryer, even with 5 balls in there. I have not noticed them leaving any fiber on clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: As God is my witness, I'll NEVER iron again! !
customer_reviews.text: I really have a problem wearing scrubs that haven't been ironed. I think they look tacky. I was griping about this onerous task to my friends, and one of them told me about these. All I can say is, WOW. They came out of the dryer all ready to be hung in the closet. Thanks for a great product! !
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: SAVING MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I love these wool dryer balls! I have completely stopped using fabric softener and dryer sheets and it has cut down on my drying time and heat temperatures which is going to bring my electric bill down as well. I use a couple drops of lemon essentials oils on each wool dryer ball and my clothes come out smelling great!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like these to help cut dryer time and to reduce the heat needed to dry. They are uniform in size and fit nicely in the included sack. I was afraid it would be loud when they were in a dryer load, but while the "thump-thump" sound of them hitting the dryer walls is audible, it is nowhere near as loud as tennis balls I have used in the past with sheets and long table cloths.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great smell. Im glad I will be saving money
customer_reviews.text: These balls did the job.. I used 4 drops of Lemon essential oil on each ball using 4 balls in a large load. Great smell. Im glad I will be saving money, I cant wait to see how long these balls last since I have only used them once, but so far so good. If they fall apart or don't last I will come back to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Save Money
customer_reviews.text: Not sure enough yet if it is going to work very well. I did have some static in some of the clothes. For the most part I think they are useful!
customer_reviews.author: P. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these in several loads now and they really work great. I haven't used them with essentials oils yet, but they do everything they say. I do recommend using several if not all in a full load. I had a little static cling in a large load but I had only used 5 of them. Yes, there is a little bit of noise but worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten to use these yet, but they look well made and I am happy. They are smaller than woolzie ones that I have but the fact that there are 8 is wonderful because I have kids and cats and sometimes a couple go missing for a few days,so having more dryer balls to work with is very nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like using these dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: I really like using these dryer balls. They're eco friendly and they really remove the lint off of your clothes. I've added essential oils to them and my clothes end up smelling fantastic! The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because they are quite noisy bouncing around in the dryer!
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Go buy these now!
customer_reviews.text: Good buy fabric softener sheets. These are the best at making fabrics soft in the dryer. Just add a drop of essential oils to the balls and make you clean fabrics smell so good!
customer_reviews.author: Biquey

customer_reviews.title: Like their softness and great for my darker colors
customer_reviews.text: Like their softness and great for my darker colors. I like that it was a package of 8 but wish that each ball, were just a tad bigger in size. One of my sweatshirt type tops, had a ball stuck in each sleeve perhaps it helped it dry quicker. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Haflett

customer_reviews.title: Say Goodbye to Dryer Sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I love these dryer balls! I finally took the plunge and invested in dryer balls and since most of my clothing is dark/colors I got these. I dropped lavender oil on 1/2 of them and now my laundry dryes faster on a lower setting AND smells of natural lavender. Say goodbye to chemical ridden dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.author: YogaMama

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality! Tried on light and dark clothing
customer_reviews.text: Nice Quality! Tried on light and dark clothing, they didn't leave any lint. My dog tore a couple completely apart and had a wonderful time. So, now I make sure I find all of them before pulling them out with the blankets! Nice that I have 6 left.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy fabric softener again!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why thee things work but I'm really impressed. Clothes and towels are soft and static free without using and fabric softener, plus are drying quicker. Btw I use these with whites as well, including brand new white towels, they don't leave and lint so I've decided I don't need white ones.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Love my new dark wool dryer balls!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently bought the Kitchow Wool Dryer Balls and swapped out my old rubber ones. I love them! I was very impressed to receive an email from their customer service when I ordered, offering some tips on how to use the balls. I tossed them in a load of older towels, a bit scratchy and rough and the towels came out of the dryer so much softer and nice to the touch. I like the option to add essential oils but appreciate the fact that they are chemical free and safe to use on the new grandson's clothes and bedding. Thanks for a great natural product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: They're balls, they go in the dryer I think they work. I haven't used a dryer sheet with them and my clothes come out fine. Don't know how you'd actually gauge if it takes less time to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dryer balls worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used them last night for the first time. I was impressed. We have a big problem with dog hair everywhere (live in an RV with 3 dogs that shed). It was nice to have all the dark T shirts come out hair free! And I do think things dried more quickly. The only problem was not having enough of them!! Did 9 loads last night!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if these would work to eliminate static cling, but it seems they do. You have to be sure to use enough of the balls given your load size, but they do work. I love that you can use your essential oils on them to get the fragrance you desire. Overall - very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kate A

customer_reviews.title: Really No Balls About It
customer_reviews.text: These are the best and work great for colored clothes because they cut down on drying time and buying softener sheets. You can use your essential oils on these and know what is being added to your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: D & J Angel

customer_reviews.title: No more dryer sheet residue
customer_reviews.text: Toss them in and no need for dryer sheets. Don't overdry the clothes or static will build up, but over-drying (running the dryer after the clothes are already dry) wastes energy anyway.
customer_reviews.author: TmS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product! Balls are dense but soft and do not clink around the dryer. They are big enough to not get lost, but still do not take up too much space in the dryer. They work!
customer_reviews.author: lilicedt

customer_reviews.title: Helpful, but don't control static in dry climate
customer_reviews.text: In Colorado, our dry air means lots of static. These don't help control static at all for me. However, I still use them because I like how they keep the laundry "fluffed up" to reduce wrinkles, and I do think they slightly shorten the dry time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie R

customer_reviews.title: pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical but they do seem to work well. The clothes seem to dry faster and they are not as wrinkled. There is a bit more static but the suggestion of getting one or more of the balls wet does seem to help with that. I like not having the perfumy dryer sheet smell on my stuff.
customer_reviews.author: A. Eklund

customer_reviews.title: Don't work--Create more static
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these, but I have more static electricity with these than using nothing. Opt for the plastic dryer balls with nubby surface. These work much better imo.
customer_reviews.author: L. L.

customer_reviews.title: Wool Dryer Balls
customer_reviews.text: I've been using dryer balls for years and have always loved them. I am sensitive to fragrance and love that this is a natural product. I never have trouble with static when I use dryer balls. I'm very happy with Kitchow's product. I use about 4 in each load, but the pack includes 8 and I'm sure the more the merrier!
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Fast shipping, arrived when promised. No lint on dark clothes and work well with Lavender essential oil. Pleased with purchase, will update down the road as I have only used them for 2 days and it is wonderful not to deal with static cling and commercial fabric softener.
customer_reviews.author: Trala

customer_reviews.title: Static :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about receiving these. The first few loads were like a dream! Perfect in every way. Now, I'm fighting static electricity. Ive tried adjusting my dryer setting, separating synthetic materials, and nothing is working. I hate static, it's the reason I was hestitant to even buy these. Trying to go chemical free and it's just not working.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Nickells

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: These balls had been recommended to me but I had put off ordering them. I am so glad that I did purchase them. My clothes are soft and static free and I don't have to use fabric softener any more! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tickled Nan

customer_reviews.title: Seem to help shorten drying time
customer_reviews.text: Seem to help shorten drying time, but I have not performed a scientifically sound experiment using these. There is no smell and no shedding.
customer_reviews.author: S. Summers

customer_reviews.title: They REALLY work!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great. My 76 yo dad does the laundry for mom, he & I and he thinks they're fantastic. We purchased both the dark color & the light color. They actually make drying time faster and it smells fresh.
customer_reviews.author: PansyCottageCreations

customer_reviews.title: Ex-Static about wool dryer balls!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have known about wool dryer balls years ago. I'm pleased that these work so well! Sometimes I add a few drops of essential oil onto the balls to make the laundry smell pretty.
customer_reviews.author: G. J.

customer_reviews.title: I find myself counting to 8
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying using these. My clothes no longer smell like whatever dryer sheet I was using; they do dry quickly. We have 1 shirt that does have static after being in the dryer but it goes away quickly upon being hung up. Cost savings, I don't know yet-that is a long term issue and I have had the less than a month. I'm going to keep using them and having actually taken them to my sister's house for her to try.
customer_reviews.author: C Thompson

customer_reviews.title: These are fabulous
customer_reviews.text: These really work. My first test was to synthetic extremely soft throws. I wash them on cold then put them in the dryer with three of my new wool dryer balls. They dried quickly and when I pulled them out of the dryer it was not a single snap crackle pop. They were completely free of static and very soft. Bravo! Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: JULIA CRAZE

customer_reviews.title: Strong Sheep Smell!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong smell of sheep - not usable in my opinion....
customer_reviews.author: Debra Resler

customer_reviews.title: NEED TO BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My daughter is on the west coast and recommended it since they are naturalist. I normally dry my clothes on the 100 setting and I only had to do it on the 50 setting I am able to get my clothes washed and dried much much faster. My other children are now considering buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky T

customer_reviews.title: These work pretty well. Now they just need to figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: A neat product. These work pretty well. Now they just need to figure out a way for them to stop rolling across the floor when I open the dryer door.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: My cats steal them
customer_reviews.text: I love putting a few drops of essential oils on the balls before I use them in the dryer. Also, they make great cat toys.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Gave one package to my son & daughter-in-law and they also loved them. Will order again soon to buy some for my other sons. Quick service was really appreciated. Many thanks, Terry
customer_reviews.author: terry d colombo

customer_reviews.title: You need these :)
customer_reviews.text: I love the dryer balls! They work better than I expected! They also arrived in a reasonable amount of time after ordering even though I chose the cheapest shipping. The dryer balls themselves were a great price...they have kept my clothes static free, even large loads of towels... And adding essential oils to them works great to make my laundry smell fresh. I highly reccomend this product to replace the chemical laden store bought dryer sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting down on drying time.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after a friend told me about them. I love that I can put a few drops of essential oils on them to fragrance the clothes if I need it. I think it has cut down on the time it takes to dry clothes, which is helpful because I have an older dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for Dryer Sheets
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace dryer sheets when drying my infant's clothes, as she kept getting rashes and I had read that even the unscented dryer sheets leave a residue. They work so great that I began using them with all of my laundry and won't be buying dryer sheets again!
customer_reviews.author: jea9nicole

customer_reviews.title: Dryer Balls That Work
customer_reviews.text: These balls are terrific. They do what it says they do. They eliminate the need for smelly dryer sheets and I don't know why but they do indeed help to dry faster.
customer_reviews.author: Bob N.

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: They just arrived and I've been able to use them. The decrease in static was great! The clothes feel softer too. I stopped using fabric softener some time ago. These are a great alternative. I would buy them again, if I ever need to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Clothes came out softer not sure on the drying time ...
customer_reviews.text: Clothes came out softer not sure on the drying time because I never really paid attention to it before.
customer_reviews.author: KT KP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! Will never use dryer sheets again!
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with these wool dryer balls. Love how it has taken the static out of my clothes when drying! So glad I got these. My daughter had some when I was visiting on vacation and I tried them. Had never even heard of such a thing. You can keep reusing them with no issues and now I have less lint in my dryer than with fabric softener sheets. Highly recommend this product! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Update: ruined my sweater.
customer_reviews.text: They are not returnable so be warned. It releases little grey and white fibers all over everything it’s drying with.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Wool dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: The dryer balls came in a timely manner and are well made. I believe they make drying clothes faster and make clothes softer. They cut down but don't eliminate all static. I really like them and will continue to use them. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: greg honeyman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you have skin sensitivity it will leave tiny fibers on bedding and drive you nuts
customer_reviews.author: Ljd

customer_reviews.title: Love these! My drying time has decreased
customer_reviews.text: Love these! My drying time has decreased; There is no static and they do not leave any lint on the clothes! These are an excellent alternative to dryer sheets. I am so glad I chose these as part of my effort to decrease chemicals in my home!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE FABRIC SOFTENERS ME.
customer_reviews.text: I stopped using fabric softener due to skin conditions on advise from my dermatologist and I stumbled on this product on Amazon and decided to give it a try and presto they worked.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: They are awesome. I don't have to buy dryer sheets anymore ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I haven't purchased these before! They are awesome. I don't have to buy dryer sheets anymore with the additional advantage of using natural products for my laundry. They keep my clothes soft. I did not have a problem with them being wet after 1 load (like some other reviewers stated), so I am able to reuse them right away for my next load.
customer_reviews.author: S. R.

customer_reviews.title: These Dryer Balls are great!!
customer_reviews.text: These Dryer Balls are great!!! I use them with my dark laundry and the laundry dries great and looks and feels good, not static. I put a couple of drops of essential oil on the ball and the laundry smells wonderful after. I love these as a healthy alternative to dryer sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these ball to dry about 5 loads and so far everything has dried quicker and static free. I've been using Woolzies Lavender oil with these balls. The directions say to use 4-5 drops per load (or something like that) but I have been adding a few more drops to get a more fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: iHippieLover

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are great!. I have been using them for several months now and love that they keep static out of my clothes without leaving the film that dryer sheets leave. Clothes can breathe!
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've only used them once so far and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've only used them once so far and love that I'm able to use my favorite essential oils to scent my clothing, and not worry about staining the dryer balls. I can also tell the difference between my dryer balls and the ones that my dogs kidnapped and play with.
customer_reviews.author: JaeGriff

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe they aren’t dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I love that they are reusable and are as effective as dryer sheets. They also come in a little cloth bag with instructions printed on the front.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Dislike
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for about 2 weeks and have not had one load of clothes come out of the dryer not staticy. Actually, they are more staticy than not using any softener. Dislike
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to cloth diaper wash routine
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these for two weeks now and have noticed a decrease in our drying times. Helps some with static too. I bought these mostly for our cloth diapers, they would take around 1.5 hours to dry fully, with the wool dryer balls it is more like 1 hour
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Softer towels & no static cling!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used once so far. Did not see a significant enough decrease in drying time to rate 5 stars, but my towels were definitely much softer and fluffier than normal. And absolutely no static cling whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: mg1221

customer_reviews.title: ... the light wool dryer balls and I am very pleased with how well they work
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the dark wool and the light wool dryer balls and I am very pleased with how well they work. I am planning to buy a set for my daughter-in-law and a couple of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So allergic to dryer sheets. These are great. My only problem was I was hoping for better pet hair removal, but to their defense we have a long haired dog that is supposed to be nonshedding, and that is also a joke. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ckirkrdh

customer_reviews.title: love these things
customer_reviews.text: love these things! I have been doing laundry for over 30 years and just recently heard of them.. gave them a try and am really impressed. this is a great product at a good price. You want to use 6-8 balls in every load so these are perfect in quanity as well
customer_reviews.author: Lana R.

customer_reviews.title: Snap, crackle,
customer_reviews.text: These balls do nothing to prevent static cling. After numerous instances of getting shocked while pulling laundry out of the dryer with the wool dryer balls, I ultimately threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Resa

customer_reviews.title: So far I have been happy with my wool dryer balls
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been happy with my wool dryer balls. Unfortunately I was hoping it would reduce the static in the clothing but it appears to be worse ... That is if I tumble them with dry clothes for a refresh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! They really do cut down on drying time ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They really do cut down on drying time and I love how I can use my essential oils to make my clothes smell good. So far my only problem is keeping my boys from taking off with them... guess they make great play toys too!

customer_reviews.title: These seem to work pretty well at keeping static down
customer_reviews.text: My wife isn't a fan of dryer sheets, so we gave these dryer balls a shot. These seem to work pretty well at keeping static down. We've tried adding lavender oil to them, too, and it makes the laundry smell fresh.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Love these, I use them in light and dark ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these, I use them in light and dark loads. Mostly because I don't have a lot of lights, but they work great! I put a couple drops of lavender on each one before I put my clothes in the dryer. Will never go back to dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.author: C. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than the ones I already had but I like that. They had a "wet wool" smell when I got them so I sprayed them with Febreeze the first couple of times I used them. They're great now.
customer_reviews.author: Toyah

customer_reviews.title: No longer a skeptic!
customer_reviews.text: I tried using the dryer balls as a substitute for fabric softener sheets with a touch of skepticism. I am so very pleasantly surprised and happy to say that they really work!!! I'll never use fabric softener in the washer or dryer again! Our clothes and linens are truly softer and with less static now since using the dryer balls. Everything dries faster now, too! Awesome!

customer_reviews.title: These are great alternative if someone is trying to avoid allergens
customer_reviews.text: These are great alternative if someone is trying to avoid allergens, irritants, or chemicals. I don't notice any static, and I feel better after using them

I was contacted before the dryer balls arrived with an email giving me tips on what works and insuring me if I had any problems I would be assisted. I highly recommend these dryer balls from this vendor!

customer_reviews.title: Just switched from conventional, plastic dryer balls and only ...
customer_reviews.text: Just switched from conventional, plastic dryer balls and only wished I had done this sooner!! Less noise in my dryer and quicker drying time!! Kitchow personally answered all my questions promptly. I will seek out this vendor again for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: K. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Great little product for laundry
customer_reviews.text: Work great---clothes and towels dry faster. Towels are soft without fabric softener. So glad I discovered these
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: My husband is amazed at how much softer his clothes feel and asked ...
customer_reviews.text: Has cut down on drying time 15-20 min per load. We do not use dryer sheets or fabric softener due to sensitive skin for several family members. My husband is amazed at how much softer his clothes feel and asked what I used! Great purchase! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Collins

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to give up dryer sheets for quite a while and I think I've hit on something better. I throw 4 of these balls in the dryer with the clothes and they come out with no static! I have only been using them for about a week now but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Morehead

product_meta.title: Kitchow Organic Dark Wool Dryer Balls, 8-Pack — Made for Drying Colors/Darks — Natural Ecofriendly Fabric Softener — Reusable Dryer Sheets for Infants
product_meta.description:
Switching to wool dryer balls can save you time, money, energy and the environment!

Have you ever pulled a warm shirt out of the dryer ready to wear it before work or school only to find out it’s so static-filled that you couldn’t pull it off your body with a team of wild horses? Annoying, isn’t it? That’s why you need Kitchow Pure Wool Dryer Balls. These organic, natural dryer sheet alternatives keep your clothes looking new and smelling fresh, but they also protect your skin because they’re hypoallergenic. 

Using them is even easier, because you can just throw them in the dryer with wet laundry and the combination of wool and circulating air will dry your laundry up to 45% faster. Choose dryer balls that are safe for the environment, safe for your baby’s skin, save the environment and save you money. Get yours today and see the difference yourself!

Do you use cloth diapers? Fabric softeners and dryer sheets contain chemicals that will build up in your diapers, creating residues that reduce absorbency. This set of 8 wool dryer balls will gently soften your cloth diapers, reduce static, and save your baby from harmful toxins and chemicals as well!

Product Details:

 * 
 * Natural dark New Zealand Wool, leaves no lint
 * 
 * Made to dry your dark, black and colored loads
 * 
 * Reduces drying time by up to 45%
 * 
 * Saves money and the environment
 * 
 * Great at removing pet hair - If you have cats or dogs you'll notice a dramatic reduction in the amount of hair left on your fabrics after drying. 
 * Reusable and Soft on Clothes
 * 
 * 100% Organic Wool from New Zealand
 * 
 * Easy on Newborn Skin
 * 
 * Satisfaction Guaranteed

Protect your skin and your clothes with super soft wool dryer balls from Kitchow; click “Add to Cart” above to get yours today.
feature_bullets: FOR DRYING DARKS/COLORS: These natural dark wool dryer balls help eliminate static from your dark and colored clothing so you can skip harsh chemicals from fabric softeners or overly-fragranced dryer sheets.
PURE, NATURAL SCENT: Your clothes will smell amazingly fresh and clean thanks to our unscented, 100% pure wool dryer balls. No more perfumes or dyes to stifle your pure, natural scent.

ECOFRIENDLY CHOICE: Unlike dryer sheets that continually need to be thrown away after every use, our reusable wool fabric softener balls help you save money, reduce waste and keep your clothes even softer and smelling good than before.

HYPOALLERGENIC: The best part of our dryer balls is that they’re made from 100% natural wool, which means they’re hypoallergenic and safe on skin and clothes. This makes them perfect for drying infant or baby clothes.
PET SAFE: Dog and cat owners, these dryer balls will dramatically reduce the amount of hair left on your clothes after drying.
